Articles.Content: Why was the buran shuttle canceled? Not just that I have seen lots of pictures of buran cockpits rotting away, forget in fields or somthing?

The Soviet Union was facing terrible economic hardships in the late 80's and when it fell in 91 Russia had even less money resulted in its cancelation in 93. To make matters worse, the hanger that housed the completed orbiter and the in progress ones collapsed in 2002 and damaged them. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Buran_programme#Buran_hangar_collapse

To answer your question though, it was due to the political atmosphere of the Soviet Union (it was about to collapse), a lack of funds, and a hanger collapse.

To a certain extent he was correct, Buran had a heaver payload to orbit capability, could be flown manned or unmanned and was a pure liquid fuelled system unlike the Shuttle

To a certain extent he was correct, Buran had a heaver payload to orbit capability, could be flown manned or unmanned and was a pure liquid fuelled system unlike the Shuttle

It also had the rather unfortunate habit of throwing away it's engines after every launch due to the fact that, unlike the NASA shuttle, it relied on a conventional launch vehicle to achieve orbit in the form of the Energia booster.

Still, the Buran had some interesting capabilities, at least on paper. Unfortunately, we'll never know if it could have lived up to that promise since the sole flight capable craft was destroyed in a hanger collapse.
